name: Chicken Meatloaf Wellington with Sun Dried Tomatoes
description: A fresh take on meatloaf! Made with chicken, scattered with sun dried tomatoes and the fresh burst of basil. Encase in puff pastry to create a cross between the British classic Beef Wellington and meatloaf (but made with chicken!).
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup roughly chopped sun dried tomatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the Filling ingredients in a bowl and use your hands to mix together. It should be quite soft and wet, not dry and crumbly.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the Filling ingredients in a bowl and use your hands to mix together. It should be quite soft and wet, not dry and crumbly.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the filling onto the puff pastry. Shape into a loaf and roll the puff pastry up, ending with the seam side down.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the filling onto the puff pastry. Shape into a loaf and roll the puff pastry up, ending with the seam side down.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to baking tray. Cut a few diagonal slashes across the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to baking tray. Cut a few diagonal slashes across the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush with egg wash and bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the pastry is deep golden brown. Turn the tray at around 25 minutes for even browning.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush with egg wash and bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the pastry is deep golden brown. Turn the tray at around 25 minutes for even browning.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven. Rest for 5 minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven. Rest for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Hi, love this recipe but can you tell me how long will left overs keep in the fridge? Thank Audrey

Made this with Simply Wize gluten free puff
Perfection and we reheated left over slices in the air fryer
Perfect thank you Nagi
Great flavours easy to make looksgreat on platter.
Kids love it, easy to make and convert to gluten free

I made this for my partner to take advantage of some cheap mince I picked up recently. He loved this dish. Thank you very much.
The only thing I changed was adding sesame seeds and cracked salt on top of the pastry to make it look a little fancier.

I love making this recipe - I’ve done it both with pork and chicken mince and both are incredibly delicious! I didn’t have any basil so used thyme and some shop brought mixed herbs which were also a winner. Did not cook in the pastry, instead a sprayed an aluminium tray and pressed it into that! And because of the lack of pastry it got a beautiful crispy top :) once again nagi has nailed it with her quick, easy and incredibly delicious recipes! Thank you x
Awesome recipe that was simple to follow, reasonably quick to cook tasty. Nagi is a legend!
I have made this for tonight's relaxed dinner however instead of one meatloaf I made several small ones in my sausage roll maker. Delicious.

My husband and I love this delicious chicken meatloaf.  It’s so easy to make and always tasty.   After cooking I divide the loaf in thirds and freeze two sections for future meals.  I serve roasted broccoli or peas as side veggies.

Tasty, minimal prep and my kids had seconds!

I used what I had handy, ground turkey and dried vs fresh herbs.

Thanks Nagi!

Holly xx
